result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shameka Sharon Brewer in court.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Shameka Sharon Brewer.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a sentencing hearing. For reasons stated on the record, Court addresses restitution. Arguments heard. Court to give decision on restitution on the day of sentencing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-28-22, filed.
Court is situating another matter and unable to hear case. Case is being spun to Judge Franke  Br 25. Parties notified and sent to room #506, safety building.

Defendant Shameka Sharon Brewer in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case heard for br. 29, Judge Kiefer by Judge Franke.

State has complied with victim notification.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 6 & 7: 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum and elements received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

AS TO COUNT 2, 3, 4, & 5: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders COUNT 2, 3, 4, & 5 are DISMISSED and read-in for purposes of sentencing.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing for defendant to appear in person.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shameka Sharon Brewer in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Shameka Sharon Brewer in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shameka Sharon Brewer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 6 and 7.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
